{"step_by_step_thinking": "Before ovulation, the follicle stimulating hormone (FSH) stimulates the growth of ovarian follicles in the ovary before the release of an egg from one follicle at ovulation. It also increases the production of estrogen in the follicles. The luteinizing hormone (LH) triggers ovulation and development of the corpus luteum. Estrogen and progesterone are hormones produced by the ovaries, they do not stimulate the development of granules in a cell.", "answer_choice": "C. FSH"}
